label: cascading_failure_01_dx_storage_capacity_019
content:
## 2026-01-20 Daily Operations Summary

- meta-03: CPU 74% | Mem 93% | Disk 87% | Conns: 600 | Net: 4.0/3.4 Mbps

- pool-rebalance: active 12 | idle 8 | waiting 4 | exhaustion 0 | max 20 | avg_wait 20ms
- pool-compaction: active 30 | idle 70 | waiting 2 | exhaustion 0 | max 100 | avg_wait 12ms

- Hit rate: 92% | Bandwidth: 3.5 Gbps | Origin requests: 12,400

- [CRITICAL] high disk usage on stor-a-20: 98%

### Deployments & Changes
- Enforced stricter per-tenant ingest caps for non-production namespaces due to high ingest (+232 TB)
- Added temporary metadata throttling for bulk namespace operations
- Increased verifier concurrency following snapshot verification failure
- No firmware updates or kernel patches applied today
- No rack power cycles or network drops other than 27 noted
- Audit log size: 98 GB

### Events
- Heavy ingest (+232 TB) pushed utilization to 86% and increased quota hard blocks to 5; enforced stricter per-tenant ingest caps for non-production namespaces
- Scrub errors rose to 38; prioritized deep scrubs on placement groups with recent high churn and scheduled follow-up replica comparisons
- Manifest backlog climbed to 5.2k alongside metadata QPS; added temporary metadata throttling for bulk namespace operations
- Snapshot verification had one failure due to verifier queue backlog; increased verifier concurrency and re-verified successfully

### On-Call
- Shift: Paige R. 10 pages. 18 tickets. Status: Degraded; utilization and tenant growth are driving repeated quota and metadata backlogs. Immediate controls: ingest caps, metadata throttling, and targeted scrubs
